meanings.definition: The action of provoking unlawful behavior or urging someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The incitements of the criminal gang led to chaos in the city.
meanings.sent2: She used positive incitements to motivate her team to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The incitements of the mischievous squirrel caused laughter in the park.
meanings.sent4: His fiery speech acted as incitements for revolution among the oppressed.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules served as clear incitements for good behavior.

meanings.definition: Something that encourages or motivates someone to take action
meanings.sent1: The promise of a reward was a strong incitement for him to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: Music can be a powerful incitement for memories and emotions.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies was an irresistible incitement for him to enter the bakery.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the finish line acted as a strong incitement for the exhausted runner.
meanings.sent5: The cheering crowd provided great incitement for the team to give their best performance.
